People who do testing, why this parsing doesn’t work ?
<@U18E0PY49|devmatt> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/devmatt/F23M7GK7S/-.java|Untitled>

file.name: -.java
file.title: Untitled
file.preview_highlight:
String myStrDate = "11/08/2013 08:48:10";
        SimpleDateFormat format = new SimpleDateFormat("MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss", Locale.US);
        try {
            Date date = format.parse(myStrDate);
            Assert.assertEquals("Parse","H",date.toString());

text: because you’re asserting that H equals date.toString() . date toString method prints the date as yyyy-mm-dd
I know, but it throws null refs each time, shouldn’t it post the expected and actual anyways ?
oh, thought it passes, where does it throw null?
@ the assert
5th line
I replaced to string just with date and it got null
expected H, got null
so Date date = format.parse(myStrDate) technically doesn’t work ?
the date can result in null if there is an error, so it might be a problem in parsing :thinking_face:
all looks good to me, makes no sense
Same, so it has to do with junit ?
nah shouldn’t be so, no way
someone would notice by now

try formatting a normal ISO pattern string and see what happens
what do you mean ‘normal iso pattern’ ?

Well
it kinda works now ?
<@U18E0PY49|devmatt> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/devmatt/F23MZV1EW/-.java|Untitled>

        Date d = df.parse("2010-07-28T22:25:51Z");
        Assert.assertEquals("Parse","H",d.getYear());

text: However
getYear returns me 110
but its no longer throwing nulls
yeah it’s -1900
date is deprecated in favor of calendar
So anyways, the problem there was my pattern ?
seems so.weird :confused:
i know haha
Yo! Is their any way I can release a update to my android app
And user doesn't need to install update.
Similar to web dev.
I am feeling so bound right now...  can't move fast..
make your app more flexible to api changes
details please.
<@U0G4JHERF> it really depends on how your app is architected.
But chances are, you will need to release an update to the Play Store.
what all can be improved in the architecture ?
I tried React Native.. But UI still not their ..
feels sluggish.

I think the issue you are having though is app design is more waterfall than what you get with web. You can’t release multiple times a day (at least not without pissing off your users).  You need to plan when to have key releases and what their features will be.
exactly.
you should also be testing pretty hard to ensure you didn’t miss anything so releasing multiple times a day shouldn’t be possible due to that.
is that the only possible way ?
It's sort of releasing boxed software.
that’s exactly what you are doing..
you are shipping builds
Yeah, but one thing you can try to do is push most of the logic/requirements onto the backend if you app has one. This way you won’t have to release as often.
most companies seem to have weekly or bi weekly release schedules
the only exception is security releases
yes.. the logic can be pushed to the backend.. but the UI changes/updates need to be handled on the client side only.
yes. But if you are at very early stage... you want to try out new things..
cool, try them out, ship frequently to beta testers
don’t ship releases more than once a week (typically)
Also my app needs to work completely offline too.
hence too much logic can't be server side too.
Yeah, that’s when you would utilize beta/alpha testers or setup a feature flagging system.
feature flagging ... what's that ?
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feature_toggle>

Essentially, you hide all features behind a flag/toggle and only enable it for certain users or what ever your criteria is. You would need to keep a list of these features on the backend and request them to see what features are enabled/disabled.
sounds nice.
thanks!
If you are using firebase, you could look into the remote config - <https://firebase.googleblog.com/2016/06/introducing-firebase-remote-config.html>
hmm...  it's just tweaking of variables using server value...
well... I get your point though..
thanks man!

I attended a talk at Spotify a few months back about dynamic UIs that are driven by a backend.. Haven’t had a chance to develop a sample project to demonstrate it. They did mention they want to look into open sourcing some of it.
However, you still need to have the UI all defined ahead of time in the app. It is just a way for you to change the layout on the fly. Say you want to show a grid instead of a list to some users.

Hi guys, I am developing an native app for about 2 years, and it is growing and growing. Since a few month ago, I enabled multidex, as the number of methods grew and grew way past th 65k methods. Problem is, the build process takes about 2 to 3 minutes on our developers macbook pros. Isn’t there a way to speed the build process ? For instance, is it possible to include some libs only when we are building the production app ? Anyone already encountered this problem ?
<@U0V8ZBY0H> have you tried the “optimizing multidex dev builds” from <https://developer.android.com/studio/build/multidex.html#dev-build>

attachments.title: Configure Apps with Over 64K Methods | Android Studio
attachments.fallback: Configure Apps with Over 64K Methods | Android Studio

text: <@U0V8ZBY0H> That’s usually a sign that you need to think about refactoring
<@U05473HHT> yeah I did
<@U08GFT5V5> yeah, I think about it, not an easy task thought

In that case, a refactoring is probably necessary. First evaluate the dependencies you have and see if there are things that are now supported in the android design/appcompat library that you can use directly (I am assuming you have these as a dependency)
For example, if you have a library for bottom sheets or something, well, that is available in the design support lib so you could refactor to use the bottom sheets from design support library.
Then you can further look to see if the library you are using, if you are only using a small subset, to extract that bit out.

Currently working with firebase storing dates, so far i have a node date with a value of `"08 22 2016”` . I receive the value correctly, however when i parse it into a Date, my month and day are 1 off
so the actual month is 08 but it returns me 07
Anyone had any similar issue with this ?
<@U18E0PY49> how are you parsing the month?
If you are using Date#getMonth(), remember that January = 0, not 1, which may explain why you are off by one.
iirc ‘compileRelease’ is still a thing

Hi all, I have a question need your help: My application draw many bitmap (bitmap can move and resize) in a view. I think I will use canvas draw bitmap. But My friend tell me addView(1 bitmap is 1 View) inside a parent view.  what is better way here? thank you

<@U1Z3GFR5W> the question is sort of vague. why is your application drawing multiple bitmaps? and if you're controlling them independently, the best option would be to have a view hold a bitmap each and let the `View` API do all the positioning for you
<@U1JKXJJ11> I want to making a similar Photo Wonder. Add sticker and emoticon in a Photo. User can add many sticker.
making a similar app :stuck_out_tongue:
use a good Image library that handles downsampling and network and do not nest views
<@U1JKXJJ11> Yes. sorry my poor English. I think I will custom view and draw every thing in onDraw
be sure to use a `FrameLayout` as the container and use a touch delegate for controls
you might not need to do custom stuff if you're displaying images from the internet
No. Sticker and photo can get from device or built in app
well, if you're not drawing stuff over the images like boxes or selections, you will not have to do custom stuff
But I got problem about memory issue. It lagging and slowly
I'm saying this because we might make bad decisions during the implementation
well, I'm using Fresco and it has a downsampling feature
you might not want to use Fresco, I used it because it seemed to have a good postprocessing feature
Did it work with 100 bitmaps (125x125 px)?
I think yes, but that's like a very very bad case, no user will place 100 bitmaps willy nilly
Yes. Because I have option duplicate sticker. So I think user may spam it
do not use `RelativeLayout` as the root view and `LinearLayout` with weights
how are you loading the images?
I decode from storage, resize it,  convert to BitmapDrawable and draw them to canvas
hmm.. try Picasso or Glide maybe, they do a lot of good optimization
use a `ImageView`
don't do manual drawing
oh, it means I will have many ImageView inside FrameLayout rootView
yes exactly
rootView.addView(ImageView) when add sticker??
right
Okie thank you. Let me try this.
how are you doing it now?
I using Frame Layout root view and List bitmap
and draw list bitmap in onDraw Frame Layout
I see
try that out and report back if it works for you, use a image library
Okie let me try with addView solution. If it works I will opensource it
<@U1JKXJJ11> Thank you so much
haha no problem :smile:

Hi there, I have some questions about HttpURLConnection timeouts. If I use setConnectTimeout(3000), if I get a connection with my server under 3s, it will work right ? Even if this is a long running http request (> 3s). On the other hand, if I use setReadTimeout(3000),  the connection will fail ?
Also, is it possible to set the readTimeout AFTER the connection was established ?
Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Correct, and probably not
Alright ! So in my case, I should set a rather small connectTimeout 3~5s and a long readTimeout
Thanks !
